semantic_title: Sequela External Cause Code with Related Current Injury Prohibition
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 20. Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > i. Sequelae (Late Effects) of External Cause Guidelines > 2) Sequela external cause code with a related current injury

content.full_text: A sequela external cause code should never be used with a related current nature of injury code. (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
content.summary: Prohibition against using sequela external cause codes with current injury codes for the same condition (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
key_concepts: Sequela and current injury codes are mutually exclusive (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
Cannot code both sequela and current injury for same condition (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Never use sequela external cause code with related current injury code (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
detailed_rules.explanation: When coding a sequela, do not also assign a current nature of injury code for the same condition, as they represent different time periods and contexts (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if condition is current injury or sequela
Step 2: If sequela, use sequela external cause code only
Step 3: Do not add current injury codes for same condition

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with chronic condition from old injury - not a new injury
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Chronic arthritis of knee, sequela of fracture 5 years ago
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify this as sequela, not current injury
Step 3: Use sequela external cause code with 7th character 'S'
Step 4: Do not use current fracture or injury codes

correct_coding.sequencing: Current condition first, sequela external cause second
correct_coding.rationale: Coding sequela, not current injury (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)

incorrect_coding.code: Current fracture code with sequela external cause
incorrect_coding.rationale: Cannot use current injury code with sequela external cause for same condition
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Mixing current and sequela codes for same condition

warnings: Never combine sequela external cause with current injury codes for same condition (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
best_practices: Clearly distinguish between current injuries and sequelae (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
common_mistakes: Using both sequela and current injury codes for same condition (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
tips: Choose either current injury OR sequela coding, not both (Evidence: pg no: 91, L33)
